data.title: Brother Machi's 25x leveraged long position in ETH was liquidated, and he reopened a long position, currently accumulating losses exceeding $29 million.
data.description: According to Onchain Lens monitoring, with the market correction, Machi's 25x leveraged ETH long position has been completely liquidated. He then opened a new 25x leveraged ETH long position after the liquidation. Currently, Machi's cumulative losses exceed $29 million.

data.title: Altcoin Season Index Shows Slight Increase in Altcoin Performance
data.description: CoinMarketCap's Altcoin Season Index has risen to 35, indicating a modest improvement in altcoin performance compared to Bitcoin. According to NS3.AI, this index evaluates the percentage of the top 100 cryptocurrencies that have outperformed Bitcoin over the last 90 days, excluding stablecoins and wrapped tokens. A score of 75 or higher denotes an 'altcoin season,' while a lower score suggests Bitcoin's dominance.

data.title: US stocks closed lower across the board for crypto stocks, with BMNR falling more than 7.14%.
data.description: According to data from msx.com, at the close of trading on the US stock market, the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 1.05%, the S&P 500 fell 0.43%, and the Nasdaq Composite fell 0.92%. The crypto sector was mixed, with UPXI falling over 12.84%, BNC falling over 9.28%, ETHZ falling over 7.59%, BMNR falling over 7.14%, and ABTC falling over 5.56%. msx.com is a decentralized RWA trading platform that has listed hundreds of RWA tokens, covering US stock and ETF tokens such as AAPL, AMZN, GOOGL, META, MSFT, NFLX, and NVDA.

data.title: Hong Kong's Leela Faces Competition from Michelin-Starred Rivals
data.description: Hong Kong's Leela, a high-end Indian restaurant, offers some exceptional dishes that make it worth a visit. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the challenges Leela faces from its Michelin-starred competitors in the region. Despite its culinary offerings, the restaurant must navigate the competitive landscape dominated by established Michelin-rated establishments. The review suggests that while Leela has standout dishes, it needs to distinguish itself further to compete effectively in Hong Kong's vibrant dining scene.

data.title: BlackRock withdrew 10,749 BTC from Coinbase in the past three days, with a total value of approximately $717 million.
data.description: According to Onchain Lens monitoring, BlackRock withdrew 4,082 BTC from Coinbase 9 hours ago, worth approximately $269.41 million. Data shows that in the past 3 days, BlackRock has withdrawn a total of 10,749 BTC from Coinbase, worth approximately $717.09 million.

data.title: U.S. President Trump Criticizes Supreme Court's Tariff Decision
data.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has voiced strong criticism against the Supreme Court's recent ruling on tariffs. According to NS3.AI, Trump believes the decision may favor foreign nations and corporations that have previously taken advantage of the U.S. economy. He expressed his disappointment, highlighting the potential for these entities to secure substantial financial benefits as a result of the ruling. Trump has called for the case to be reconsidered or retried to address these issues.

data.title: Trump Media & Technology Group Sells 2,000 BTC, Adjusting Bitcoin Holdings
data.description: Trump Media & Technology Group has sold 2,000 Bitcoin, reducing its reserves from 11,452 to 9,452 BTC. According to NS3.AI, this information was revealed in the company's latest 10-K annual report, with analysis provided by Arkham analyst Emmett Gallic. The transaction indicates a significant change in the company's approach to managing its Bitcoin assets.

data.title: PRECIOUS METALS | Palladium Prices Stabilize Amid Industrial Demand Shifts
data.description:
Palladium prices have shown significant volatility since 2020, initially surging above $3,400 before declining to around $1,000. According to NS3.AI, this fluctuation was driven by changes in industrial demand and the adoption of electric vehicles (EVs). Recently, prices have stabilized, reclaiming key moving averages, with a crucial resistance zone identified between $1,900 and $2,000. This development could indicate a potential shift in the long-term outlook for the metal.

Palladium remains sensitive to various factors, including auto production levels, the substitution of platinum, and trends in the US Dollar. These elements contribute to the metal's balance between recovery prospects and ongoing structural challenges.

data.title: SEC Accelerates Efforts to Modernize Cryptocurrency Regulations
data.description: SEC Chair Paul Atkins has recognized that the United States missed an early chance to effectively regulate cryptocurrencies. According to NS3.AI, the SEC is now accelerating its efforts to modernize crypto regulations. Since the Trump administration, the SEC has become more receptive, establishing a crypto task force, retracting certain enforcement actions, and initiating Project Crypto to update the regulatory framework. Recent developments include the approval of WisdomTree's crypto market fund for 24/7 trading with instant settlement, alongside plans to investigate tokenized bank deposit products.

data.title: Bitcoin(BTC) Surpasses 66,000 USDT with a Narrowed 1.97% Decrease in 24 Hours
data.description: On Feb 28, 2026, 00:14 AM(UTC). According to Binance Market Data, Bitcoin has crossed the 66,000 USDT benchmark and is now trading at 66,005.679688 USDT, with a narrowed narrowed 1.97% decrease in 24 hours.

data.title: Paradigm plans to raise up to $1.5 billion to establish a new fund to invest in cutting-edge fields such as AI and robotics.
data.description: Crypto venture capital firm Paradigm is planning to raise up to $1.5 billion for its new fund. Sources familiar with the matter say the new fund will continue its focus on crypto assets while also expanding its investment portfolio to cutting-edge technologies such as artificial intelligence and robotics. (Wall Street Journal)

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | EU Reaffirms Stance on Afghanistan's Territorial Use
data.description: The European Council has reiterated the European Union's position that Afghanistan's territory must not be used to threaten or attack other countries. According to Jin10, this statement underscores the EU's commitment to maintaining regional stability and preventing any potential threats emanating from Afghanistan. The council's declaration comes amid ongoing concerns about security and geopolitical dynamics in the region. The EU continues to monitor the situation closely, emphasizing the importance of international cooperation in addressing these challenges.

data.title: MoonPay launches the PYUSDx framework, supporting the issuance of branded stablecoins based on PayPal PYUSD.
data.description: MoonPay has launched the PYUSDx framework, allowing developers to issue branded, application-specific stablecoins with PayPal USD (PYUSD) as the reserve asset. This solution combines M0's stablecoin infrastructure protocol with MoonPay's issuance and distribution capabilities, separating reserve management from token issuance to accelerate the stablecoin launch process. Under this architecture, PYUSD, issued by Paxos Trust, serves as the underlying reserve asset, while the branded stablecoin is issued by MoonPay Digital Assets. The latter recently obtained a New York State trust license, enabling it to act as a stablecoin issuer. Developers can launch custom stablecoins without having to build their own underlying technology and operational systems. With this product's launch, the market is also focused on whether it complies with the regulatory framework of the US GENIUS Act and the future applicability of the tokens in different jurisdictions.

data.title: SEC Chairman: The U.S. missed the window of opportunity for crypto regulation and is now accelerating the modernization of its rules.
data.description: U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chairman Paul Atkins stated that the SEC is reviving its pace of cryptocurrency regulation to address previous policy shortcomings. Speaking at an event at the University of Texas, he pointed out that regulators have historically failed to keep pace with industry innovation. Atkins noted that since the Donald Trump administration took office, the SEC has adopted a more open stance, establishing a cryptocurrency task force, withdrawing several enforcement cases, and launching "Project Crypto" to drive updates to the regulatory framework. He emphasized that the focus is more on the future applications of distributed ledger technology in payment, clearing, and settlement systems than on short-term price fluctuations. Furthermore, the SEC this week approved WisdomTree's digital currency market fund to offer 24/7 trading and instant settlement. Atkins also revealed plans to explore tokenized bank deposit products in the future. (The Block)

data.title: Trump posted a message calling on the Supreme Court to reconsider or reopen his tariff policy case.
data.description: US President Trump posted on social media that the recent Supreme Court ruling on tariffs could send tens of billions of dollars back to countries and companies that have been "exploiting" the US for years, and that, according to the ruling, they might actually continue to do so, even to a higher level. I believe the Supreme Court didn't consider this! It's truly disappointing, to say the least, that those countries and companies that have taken advantage of us for decades and obtained billions of dollars they shouldn't have are now entitled to an unprecedented "ill-gotten gain." Is it possible for this case to be retried or reopened? (Jinshi)

data.title: Pentagon Agrees to OpenAI's Secure Deployment Rules in Confidential Settings
data.description: The Pentagon has reportedly agreed to the rules set by OpenAI for the secure deployment of its technology in confidential environments, according to Jin10. However, no contracts have been signed yet, indicating ongoing discussions between the two parties. This development highlights the increasing interest in integrating advanced AI technologies within government operations while ensuring security and confidentiality. The collaboration could potentially enhance the capabilities of defense systems, although formal agreements are still pending.

data.title: Hawthorne Race Course Files for Bankruptcy Amid Financial Struggles
data.description: Hawthorne Race Course has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in Chicago, following ongoing financial difficulties. Bloomberg posted on X that the filing comes after several months of complaints from horse owners about bounced checks and unpaid purse money. The racecourse has been facing financial challenges, leading to this decision to seek bankruptcy protection. The filing aims to restructure the racecourse's debts and address the financial issues that have affected its operations. The situation has raised concerns among stakeholders about the future of the racecourse and its ability to meet financial obligations.

data.title: Vitalik Buterin Mapped Out Where Ethereum Is Heading – Short Term and Long Term
data.description:
Ethereum’s scaling roadmap got a detailed public airing this week, straight from Vitalik Buterin himself. The thread covers two distinct timeframes, and the gap between them is wider than most people probably realize. The Near Term: Glamsterdam Does the Heavy Lifting The next meaningful upgrade, Glamsterdam, carries more technical weight than its name suggests
source: https://www.ethnews.com/vitalik-buterin-mapped-out-where-ethereum-is-heading-short-term-and-long-term/

data.title: Solana Co-Founder Claims Greater Decentralization Than Ethereum
data.description: Solana co-founder Anatoly Yakovenko has stated that Solana's network offers a higher level of decentralization compared to Ethereum. According to NS3.AI, Yakovenko bases this claim on the original decentralization concept introduced by Satoshi Nakamoto. He highlights that Solana enables anyone to verify the ledger using a node without the need for high-end hardware. Additionally, Yakovenko emphasizes that Solana's architecture prevents the network from stealing user funds, setting it apart from systems that rely on multi-signature security councils.
